summary: Detail-oriented, self-motivated, focused, proactive, analytical, and curious graduate with education in both MBA and computer engineering. Expertise in coordinating diverse teams and resources to complete business objectives.

experience.position: Technical Project Manager & Senior Design Engineer
responsibilities: Coordinate custom test fixture development activities and dependencies across internal teams and external partners!

Develop detailed project plans, timelines, and resource allocation
Manage test development projects and initiatives through planning, development, and deployment to support NPI and volume manufacturing.

Defined project scope, goals, and deliverables in collaboration with stakeholders.
Monitor project progress, track milestones, and ensure timely completion of deliverables.
Coordinate the proposal and selection process of suppliers for test fixture components and joint design manufacturer (JDM) partner solutions.

Drive communication with internal stakeholders, vendors, and contract manufacturers for status reviews, identifying problems, escalating issues, creating solutions, and implementing improvements via meetings and dashboards
Maintain and co-author technical documentation used for test plans, test processes, and initiatives, including creating presentations, dashboards, and requirements documents.

Collaborate with software leaders, stakeholders and release and project/program managers, to plan software release schedules and activities that maximize date and quality predictability and manage risk.
Develop and maintain a strategic vision and roadmap for the team and evolve it over time. Plan and prioritize the implementation.

Collaborating with the offshore and on-site team members for in-vehicle defect reproduction of identified defects

Hands-on, roll-up-your-sleeves approach with high sense of urgency and drive for result to produce innovation, agility, and velocity to support business-as-usual operations and new project implementation and administration.
